intro: Leucas randii, commonly known as the yellow leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural and traditional uses.
